import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Confirm ticket issue"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/tickets/{ticketId}/confirm-issue"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Confirms the selected issue (problem category) on a ticket before work begins.

**Prerequisites**
1. **ticketId** – Locate the ticket via [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) and extract `Items[].TicketId`.
2. **Issue selection** – Ensure the ticket already has the appropriate issue assigned (for example during creation or via the issue picker UI).

**Workflow Example**
1. Search for the ticket: [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) with queue filters → capture `Items[0].TicketId`.
2. Present the issue confirmation dialog to the technician.
3. Call [POST /api/v1.0/tickets/\{ticketId\}/confirm-issue](/docs/api/tickets/confirm-ticket-issue) to acknowledge the chosen issue.
4. Immediately follow with [POST /api/v1.0/tickets/\{ticketId\}/start](/docs/api/tickets/start-ticket) so timers, permissions, and recommended next steps refresh for the technician.

**Minimal Required Fields**: ticketId

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

  parameters={[{"name":"ticketId","in":"path","required":true,"description":"UUID of the ticket whose issue should be confirmed. >
  
</ParamsDetails>

  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
